revision.text:
{{automatic taxobox | fossil_range = [[Oligocene|Late Oligocene]] ([[Deseadan]])-Recent
~{{Fossil range|23|0}} | image = Dasyprocta punctata (Gamboa, Panama).jpg | image_caption = [[Central American agouti]], ''D. punctata'' | taxon = Dasyproctidae | authority = Gray 1825 | subdivision_ranks = Genera | subdivision = [[Dasyproctidae#Classification|See text]] }} '''Dasyproctidae''' is a family of large [[South America]]n [[rodent]]s, comprising the [[agouti]]s and [[acouchi]]s.{{MSW3 Hystricognathi | id = 13400223 | page = }} Their fur is a reddish or dark colour above, with a paler underside. They are [[herbivore|herbivorous]], often feeding on ripe [[fruit]] that falls from trees. They live in burrows, and, like [[squirrel]]s, will bury some of their food for later use.{{cite book|editor= Macdonald, D.|author= Bishop, Ian|year= 1984|title= The Encyclopedia of Mammals|publisher= Facts on File|location= New York|page= [https://archive.org/details/encyclopediaofma00mals_0/page/701 701]|isbn= 0-87196-871-1|url-access= registration|url= https://archive.org/details/encyclopediaofma00mals_0/page/701}} Dasyproctids exist in Central and South America, which are the tropical parts of the New World. The fossil record of this family can be traced back to the Late Oligocene ([[Deseadan]] in the [[South American land mammal age|SALMA classification]]). As with all rodents, members of this family have incisors, pre-molars, and molars, but no canines. The cheek teeth are [[hypsodonty|hypsodont]] and flat-crowned. == Classification == Fossil taxa follow McKenna and Bell,{{cite book |last1=McKenna |first1=Malcolm C. |last2=Bell |first2=Susan K |date=1997 |title=Classification of Mammals Above the Species Level |publisher=Columbia University Press |location=New York |isbn=0-231-11013-8}} with modifications following Kramarz.{{cite journal |last=Kramarz |first=A. G. |date=2005 |title=A primitive cephalomyid hystricognath rodent from the early Miocene of northern Patagonia, Argentina |journal=[[Acta Palaeontologica Polonica]] |volume=50 |issue=2 |pages=249-258 |url=https://www.app.pan.pl/article/item/app50-249.html}} * '''Family Dasyproctidae''' ** Genus †''[[Alloiomys]]'' ** Genus †''[[Australoprocta]]'' ** Genus †''[[Branisamys]]'' ** Genus †''[[Incamys]]'' ** Genus †''[[Neoreomys]]'' ** Genus †''[[Megastus]]'' ** Genus †''[[Palmiramys]]'' ** Genus ''[[Dasyprocta]]'' *** [[Azara's agouti]], ''D. azarae'' *** [[Coiban agouti]], ''D. coibae'' *** [[Crested agouti]], ''D. cristata'' *** [[Black agouti]], ''D. fuliginosa'' *** [[Orinoco agouti]], ''D. guamara'' *** [[Kalinowski's agouti]], ''D. kalinowskii'' *** [[Red-rumped agouti]], ''D. leporina'' *** [[Mexican agouti]], ''D. mexicana'' *** [[Black-rumped agouti]], ''D. prymnolopha'' *** [[Central American agouti]], ''D. punctata'' *** [[Ruatan Island agouti]], ''D. ruatanica'' ** Genus ''[[Myoprocta]]'' *** [[Green acouchi]], ''M. pratti'' *** [[Red acouchi]], ''M. acouchy'' The [[paca]]s (genus ''Cuniculus'') are placed by some authorities{{cite encyclopedia |last=Woods |first=C. A. |date=1993 |title=Hystricognathi |work=[[Mammal Species of the World|Mammal Species of the World: A Taxonomic and Geographic Reference]] |editor-first1=D. E. |editor-last1=Wilson |editor-first2=D. M. |editor-last2=Reeder |publisher=Smithsonian Institution Press |location=Washington D.C.}} in Dasyproctidae, but molecular studies have demonstrated they do not form a monophyletic group.{{cite journal |last1=Rowe |first1=D. L. |first2=R. L. |last2=Honeycutt |date=2002 |title=Phylogenetic relationships, ecological correlates, and molecular evolution within the Cavioidea (Mammalia, Rodentia) |journal=[[Molecular Biology and Evolution]] |volume=19 |pages=263-277}} == References == {{Portal|Mammals|Prehistoric mammals}} {{Reflist}} == External links == * [http://www.mnh.si.edu/mna/image_info.cfm?species_id=463 Central American agouti at Smithsonian] * [http://animaldiversity.org/accounts/Dasyproctidae/ Dasyproctidae at Animaldiversity.org] * [http://www.scielo.br/scielo.php?script=sci_arttext&pid=S1519-69842014000300585 2014 - Figueira et al. - Carrion consumption by Dasyprocta leporina (Rodentia: Dasyproctidae) and a review of meat use by agoutis] {{Rodents}} {{Dasyproctidae nav}} {{Taxonbar|from=Q267132}} [[Category:Dasyproctidae| ]] [[Category:Hystricognath rodents]] [[Category:Rodent families]] [[Category:Extant Chattian first appearances]] [[Category:Mammals described in 1825]]
